simplenlg.syntax

Class ClauseHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • simplenlg.syntax.ClauseHelper

  • public abstract class ClauseHelper
extends Object

    This is a helper class containing the main methods for realising the syntax of clauses. It is used exclusively by the SyntaxProcessor.

    Version:
    4.0
    Author:
    D. Westwater, University of Aberdeen.

      • realise

        public abstract NLGElement realise(SyntaxProcessor parent,
                                   PhraseElement phrase)
        The main method for controlling the syntax realisation of clauses.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent SyntaxProcessor that called this method.
        phrase - the PhraseElement representation of the clause.
        Returns:
        the NLGElement representing the realised clause.

                                    NLGElement verbElement,
                                    boolean whObj)
        Realises the verb part of the clause.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the PhraseElement representing this clause.
        parent - the parent SyntaxProcessor that will do the realisation of the complementiser.
        realisedElement - the current realisation of the clause.
        splitVerb - an NLGElement representing the subjects that should split the verb
        verbElement - the NLGElement representing the verb phrase for this clause.
        whObj - whether the VP is part of an object WH-interrogative

        protected ListElement realiseSubjects(PhraseElement phrase,

        Realises the subjects for the clause.
        Parameters:

      • realiseInterrogative

        protected abstract NLGElement realiseInterrogative(PhraseElement phrase,
                                                   SyntaxProcessor parent,
                                                   ListElement realisedElement,
                                                   NLGFactory phraseFactory,
                                                   NLGElement verbElement)
        This is the main controlling method for handling interrogative clauses. The actual steps taken are dependent on the type of question being asked. The method also determines if there is a subject that will split the verb group of the clause. For example, the clause the man should give the woman the flower has the verb group indicated in bold. The phrase is rearranged as yes/no question as should the man give the woman the flower with the subject the man splitting the verb group.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the PhraseElement representing this clause.
        parent - the parent SyntaxProcessor that will do the realisation of the complementiser.
        realisedElement - the current realisation of the clause.
        phraseFactory - the phrase factory to be used.
        verbElement - the NLGElement representing the verb phrase for this clause.
        Returns:
        an NLGElement representing a subject that should split the verb

      • realiseObjectWHInterrogative

        protected abstract NLGElement realiseObjectWHInterrogative(String keyword,
                                                           PhraseElement phrase,
                                                           SyntaxProcessor parent,
                                                           ListElement realisedElement,
                                                           NLGFactory phraseFactory)
        Controls the realisation of wh object questions.
        Parameters:
        keyword - the wh word
        phrase - the PhraseElement representing this clause.
        parent - the parent SyntaxProcessor that will do the realisation of the complementiser.
        realisedElement - the current realisation of the clause.
        phraseFactory - the phrase factory to be used.
        Returns:
        an NLGElement representing a subject that should split the verb

      • realiseInterrogativeKeyWord

        protected void realiseInterrogativeKeyWord(String keyWord,
                                           LexicalCategory cat,
                                           PhraseElement phrase,
                                           SyntaxProcessor parent,
                                           ListElement realisedElement,
                                           NLGFactory phraseFactory)
        Realises the key word of the interrogative. For example, who, what
        Parameters:
        keyWord - the key word of the interrogative.
        cat - the category (usually pronoun, but not in the case of "how many")
        parent - the parent SyntaxProcessor that will do the realisation of the complementiser.
        realisedElement - the current realisation of the clause.
        phraseFactory - the phrase factory to be used.

      • realiseYesNo

        protected abstract NLGElement realiseYesNo(PhraseElement phrase,
                                           SyntaxProcessor parent,
                                           NLGElement verbElement,
                                           NLGFactory phraseFactory,
                                           ListElement realisedElement)
        Performs the realisation for YES/NO types of questions. This may involve adding an optional do auxiliary verb to the beginning of the clause. The method also determines if there is a subject that will split the verb group of the clause. For example, the clause the man should give the woman the flower has the verb group indicated in bold. The phrase is rearranged as yes/no question as should the man give the woman the flower with the subject the man splitting the verb group.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the PhraseElement representing this clause.
        parent - the parent SyntaxProcessor that will do the realisation of the complementiser.
        realisedElement - the current realisation of the clause.
        phraseFactory - the phrase factory to be used.
        verbElement - the NLGElement representing the verb phrase for this clause.
        Returns:
        an NLGElement representing a subject that should split the verb

      • addCuePhrase

        protected void addCuePhrase(PhraseElement phrase,
                            SyntaxProcessor parent,
                            ListElement realisedElement)
        Realises the cue phrase for the clause if it exists.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the PhraseElement representing this clause.
        parent - the parent SyntaxProcessor that will do the realisation of the complementiser.
        realisedElement - the current realisation of the clause.

      • addComplementiser

        protected void addComplementiser(PhraseElement phrase,
                                 SyntaxProcessor parent,
                                 ListElement realisedElement)
        Checks to see if this clause is a subordinate clause. If it is then the complementiser is added as a component to the realised element unless the complementiser has been suppressed.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the PhraseElement representing this clause.
        parent - the parent SyntaxProcessor that will do the realisation of the complementiser.
        realisedElement - the current realisation of the clause.

      • copyFrontModifiers

        protected void copyFrontModifiers(PhraseElement phrase,
                                  NLGElement verbElement)
        Copies the front modifiers of the clause to the list of post-modifiers of the verb only if the phrase has infinitive form.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the PhraseElement representing this clause.
        verbElement - the NLGElement representing the verb phrase for this clause.

      • checkDiscourseFunction

        protected abstract void checkDiscourseFunction(PhraseElement phrase)
        Checks the discourse function of the clause and alters the form of the clause as necessary. The following algorithm is used: 

         If the clause represents a direct or indirect object then
      If form is currently Imperative then
           Set form to Infinitive
           Suppress the complementiser
      If form is currently Gerund and there are no subjects
         Suppress the complementiser
 If the clause represents a subject then
      Set the form to be Gerund
      Suppress the complementiser
        Parameters:
        phrase - the PhraseElement representing this clause.

      • checkSubjectNumberPerson

        protected abstract void checkSubjectNumberPerson(PhraseElement phrase,
                                                 NLGElement verbElement)
        Checks the subjects of the phrase to determine if there is more than one subject. This ensures that the verb phrase is correctly set. Also set person correctly
        Parameters:
        phrase - the PhraseElement representing this clause.
        verbElement - the NLGElement representing the verb phrase for this clause.
